item.description:
Cape Ann's many wild areas have been sitting quietly untrod by Seacoast Outdoors boots until only very recently. But we've been changing that lately.

Because of the short notice, only a few of us were able to attend our last hike at Ravenswood. I wanted to return so others could experience it as well. And I doubt the original group will mind, considering there are miles of other trails AND an all-new pub to visit this time around... 

First... 

Ravenswood Park beckons with 10 miles of (mostly flat) hiking and carriage trails, moss-covered boulders, a magnolia swamp boardwalk trail, and a scenic overlook of Gloucester Harbor. This is a 600-acre Trustees of Reservations forest preserve with remnants of early colonial and Native-American settlement. And it's truly beautiful, just ask any of us who came before.

Our walk was punctuated last time by a very loud and conspicuous red-bellied woodpecker that was working a trailside snag as we entered. And there's a nature center staffed by the gracious and informative, Romona (who failed to join us for a pint last time. We'll be more persuasive this time.)

After a few hours' hike, we'll head to Gloucester, which promises seafaring history, music, and ale! (Here's the pub part you've been waiting for...)

We'll visit the Minglewood Tavern for flatbread pizza, chili, burgers, and a couple of pints. They have 20 beers on tap, and a great music lineup starting later on at 9pm for those who want to stay. And wow, there's a tree growing right out of the bar!

And if the weather is nice, maybe we can walk around town afterward before returning for the music, since seriously, so many of us don't like these days to end...

Portsmouth Carpool: 11 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the back of the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave. Meet at the back of the 

lot.

Newburyport Carpool: 11:15 AM. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95. (Post a comment if you want to meet here.)

No Pets.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Cape Ann Caper, Part III: Wood Ravens & Mingle!
